LANG_DESC: Choose the language in which to use CodyColor
NO_CONNECT_DESC: You have to connect to the server to use online features. Check your Internet connection.
OUTDATED_VERSION_DESC: You have to update CodyColor to use online features. Quit from your browser, re-open it and refresh the page to update.
CODE_NOT_VALID: The code is not valid anymore.
NOTIF_OFFLINE: You are offline. Trying to connect to the server...
ENEMY_REQUEST_NM: Your opponent wants to play again!
ENEMY_WAIT: Wait for the opponent to confirm his participation…
CHAT_SEND: Send a chat message to the opponent
MODAL_EXIT_DESC: Are you sure you want to leave the match?
BOOTCAMPMAKING_DESC: In this game mode you have the possibility to train in single player. You can choose the duration of each game, and possibly, whether to use a bot as an opponent.
CUSTOM_MATCH_DESC: This mode allows you to create custom private matches: you can choose the various game options, and invite who you want through the code generated by the program!
JOIN_DESC: Did a friend send you the code to join his game? Enter it here to start playing!
AGA_MATCH_DESC: The Battle Royale mode allows you to create real tournaments, giving users the chance to compete in games with up to 100 players simultaneously in the same playground!
AGA_FOUND: Battle found! Choose a nickname to join.
BATTLE_WELCOME: Welcome to the Battle "{{ gameName }}"! Every match will last {{ battleTime }}; they can be hosted a maximum of {{ maxPlayers }} players.
WHEN_TIMER: All users connected at the end of the countdown will fight:
WHEN_INSTANT: The match will start when the organizer will click the start button.
INVITE_DESC: You can invite other opponents by sending them the code below, to be inserted in the "Battle Royale" screen of the game, or directly via the link. Press one of the two items to copy them to the clipboard.
NEW_ROYALE_DESC: From this screen you can customize the various aspects of the battle you are creating. You can also decide whether to start the tournament on a certain date-time, or start it manually when you wish.
MATCH_JOINED: Welcome to the private match of {{enemyNickname}}! The opponent has set the duration of each match to {{totTime}}. Choose your nickname and press the start button when you are ready.
WAIT_SKIP: Wait for the opponent to confirm the skip…
NEW_CUSTOM_MATCH_DESC: Choose the nickname with which to appear to the opponent, and the various game options. CodyColor will generate a new private game to which you can invite your friend.
ENEMY_INVITATION_DESC: Your match is ready! You can invite the opponent by sending him the code below, to be inserted in the "custom game" screen. Press the code to copy it to the clipboard.
ENEMY_INVITATION_SUB_DESC: Alternatively, you can invite the opponent via the following link. Just click in it to enter the game. Press the link to copy it to the clipboard.
RANDOM_MMAKING_DESC: Choose the nickname with which to appear in the next game; CodyColor will arrange to find a random opponent among those waiting to play.
ENEMIES_WAITING: {{randomWaitingPlayers}} players are waiting for an opponent now
FORCE_EXIT: An error occurred in the server connection. Match aborted.
NO_NEW_ENEMY: There are no opponents at the moment. Match aborted.
RULES:
CodyColor MultiPlayer is the online implementation of the CodyColor unplugged coding method. It allows connected users to challenge each other in pairs, letting the game itself randomly select its opponent, or creating custom games to which you can invite your friends.

Once you have accessed the game, the user is faced with a colored chess board and a robot (Roby). Each player must place his robot, dragging it in one of the starting positions (indicated by the arrows at the edges of the board) within the time limit. When players have positioned their robots, they will begin to move inside the board, taking a different direction depending on the color of the tiles:

At the yellow tiles, Roby will turn 90 degrees to the left.

Next to the and red tiles, 90 degrees to the right.

In correspondence with the gray tiles, it will continue straight.

The aim of the game is to choose a starting position such that the robot remains inside the chessboard as long as possible. Wins the player who scores the most points at the end of the game; points that can be earned by traveling as long as possible inside the chess board, or by positioning your robot more quickly than the opponent. In the event of an absolute draw, the player who first placed his Roby wins.

Once the game is over, players can decide to do more matches in a sequence.
